programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: On the last leg of his railway journey around the north west coast of England, Michael meets a lifelong fan of Alfred Wainwright's famous guidebooks and takes the first steps along his Coast to Coast path. In Whitehaven, once the third-busiest port in Britain, Michael visits a family butcher where they've made traditional Cumberland sausages for a hundred years. Heading inland to Cockermouth, he learns about William Wordsworth's great love for the River Derwent, which flows alongside the garden of Wordsworth House. Michael finishes his journey in Maryport, where the Solway Firth marks the border between England and Scotland and where the tidal surge sweeps in big fish for the fishermen still using traditional Haaf nets to catch them.

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie takes on Flo to create a celebration garden in Groby.

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: The team are in north London, helping Grandmother Maura give her messy lounge a makeover. In just 24 hours, and on a limited budget, they build a birdwatching area for her grandchildren, fix the unsafe stairs, and give the living room a new identity, creating a multipurpose family space.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Idées et conseils d'experts pour entretenir son jardin.

programme.title: Nicky Campbell BBC News Talk
programme.desc: Nicky Campbell takes your calls on the day's talking points, hearing views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 between 9am and 11am on weekdays (calls are free from mobiles and landlines).

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A suivre, les dernières actualités présentées par les équipes rédactionnelles de la BBC, le très réputé radiodiffuseur du service public britannique. Créée en 1922 à Londres, la British Broadcast Corporation est connue pour être la plus ancienne société diffusant des programmes de radio ou de télévision au monde.

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Entertaining and educational British quiz show, hosted by Rick Edwards, where 24 regular contestants compete throughout the series to answer tricky questions. But some of the optional answers are designed to be ''impossible'', or at the very least inconsistent with the information given. The participants must avoid selecting these booby trap answer and the best one wins the £10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the show where every day a new team of challengers take on probably the greatest quiz team in Britain.

programme.title: James Martin's Food Map of Britain
programme.desc: James investigates the environmental factors that have created the Rhubarb Triangle.

programme.title: A Countryside Summer
programme.desc: Gethin Jones delivers the ultimate guide to a countryside summer featuring wildlife, food, gardening and outdoor adventure, all brought to you by a selection of favourite faces. In this episode, James Martin makes an 'nduja sausage and sheep's cheese pizza, Steve Brown learns about a UK crop of camomile, and Frances Tophill visits a woman in Somerset who grows an impressive range of Thai vegetables.

programme.title: What Britain Buys and Sells in a Day
programme.desc: Saison 1 Episode 3 The logistics that enable Britain to buy and sell millions of cars around the world. Année de réalisation : 2019

programme.title: Back in Time for the Corner Shop
programme.desc: This time the family are running their corner shop through the 80s and 90s. No longer the primary shopping destination, the corner shop is now where we go for last minute top ups and impulse buys. The shop now stocks over 2000 different items - while every-day essentials like bread and milk are still top sellers, they now share shelf space with hair mousse, extra strong bleach and pencil cases.

programme.title: Flog It !
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents a collection of the best finds from the show's travels around the country, visiting Edinburgh, Wallasey, Southwell, Birmingham and Dunster Castle. The antiques experts include Anita Manning and Mark Stacey, with items ranging from a fantastic set of Beatles autographs to a collection of Matchbox toys in pristine condition. Paul also visits the birthplace of DH Lawrence.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: The celebrities face their final quizzes, and the week's winner is crowned.

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo has reached Lincolnshire, where his coastal railway journey from Middlesbrough ends. In Grimsby Town, he investigates an important new stage in the town's history - as a maintenance base for some of the largest wind farms in the world. In neighbouring Cleethorpes, Michael is excited to ride on the Cleethorpes Coast Light Railway, pulled by a miniature steam locomotive, and on the shores of the mighty Humber estuary, Michael meets the Humber King, who holds the record for swimming across the Humber. From Cleethorpes, Michael makes for a curious and wild stretch of coastline at Humberston. At Young's, he learns how half of all scampi produced in the UK is made - and trys it himself.

programme.title: Today at the Test: England v India
programme.sub-title: First Test: Day Two Highlights England v Ireland
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Idées et conseils d'experts pour entretenir son jardin.

programme.title: Hidden Treasures of the National Trust
programme.desc: Saving a unique Victorian clock, a damaged portrait and a handmade puppet from WW2.

programme.title: Mortimer & Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Paul Whitehouse and Bob Mortimer, alongside trusty terrier Ted, travel to the Crogen Estate in north Wales to fish the River Dee for the glorious grayling, a fish which has so far eluded Paul on their extensive travels. They fish hard on a secluded private estate, while Bob sets up a bijou coffee shop and Paul tries to concentrate on landing the prized fish. Along the way, they try to rediscover their lost youth on this trip, with mixed results.

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories. With Victoria Derbyshire.

programme.title: MOTDx
programme.desc: MOTDx is a fun television show dedicated to football. Join retired footballer Jermaine Jenas and his football-loving friends, Craig Mitch, Chelcee Grimes and Reece Parkinson. They discuss everything about the English Premier League, including the latest news, teams, goals and skills, and talk to the biggest stars of the nation's favorite sport.

programme.title: Strike: Inside the Unions
programme.desc: Following the escalation of the biggest workers' movement in a generation. Amazon workers in Coventry are to hold the UK's first strike for the global business giant, and Pat Cullen from the Royal College of Nurses comes to the fore as the nurses' dispute with the government faces supreme challenges.

programme.title: Once Upon a Time Northern Ireland
programme.sub-title: It Wasn't Like a Movie Anymore
programme.desc: A time of relative peace in Northern Ireland escalates to full-blown conflict. As a civil rights movement gains pace, demanding equal rights for Catholics, the Provisional IRA comes to the fore, causing the British Army to be deployed. With the situation compounded by tactical mistakes, soldiers quickly find themselves caught up in violent clashes - leading to 13 unarmed Catholics being shot dead by British paratroopers in Derry on what becomes known as Bloody Sunday.

programme.title: Forensics: The Real CSI
programme.desc: At midday on a busy high street in Birmingham, a group of armed robbers drive a truck into a jewellery shop, stealing £300,000 worth of gold. They escape in less than 60 seconds. Forensic scene investigator Drew Birtles is dispatched to the jewellery shop to recover any forensic clues which could help identify the robbers. The investigation becomes more challenging when no real forensic evidence is found at the crime scene and the robbers switch cars - leaving the trail to go cold. Suspects are identified, and investigators hope that forensic evidence from the cars could provide the vital information needed to help solve the case and bring down the thieves.

programme.title: Matt Willis: Fighting Addiction
programme.desc: Busted's Matt Willis explores his addictions, how it affects his family and what can help.

programme.title: This is BBC Two
programme.desc: This is BBC Two.
